alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 28 at 2:39AM PDT until October 29 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 expected in southern Oregon and as low as 20 in Siskiyou County. For the second Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 in southern Oregon and as low as 18 in Siskiyou County possible. * WHERE...In California, Western Siskiyou County and Central Siskiyou County. In Oregon, Central Douglas County, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County and Jackson County. This includes the Scott, Rogue, Klamath River, Shasta, Umpqua and Illinois valleys. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM PDT this morning. For the second Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Locations in far northwest Douglas County, including Scottsburg, are more likely to remain above freezing with lows 33 to 35 degrees. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
